growing.water: High; consistent moisture is important, especially during fruiting
growing.soil: Slightly acidic, rich soil with plenty of compost; mulch recommended to retain moisture and suppress weeds

planting.spacing: 1-2 feet apart, with rows spaced about 4 feet apart
planting.whenToPlant: Plant in spring after danger of frost; raised beds are ideal for drainage and warmth
planting.propagation: Strawberries produce runners (stolons) that root and form new plants
planting.depth: Relatively shallow; crown should sit at soil level

pruning: Remove runners if spreading is not desired to encourage more fruit production
Allow some runners if you want the patch to expand naturally
careAndMaintenance.notes: Strawberries are short-lived perennials; beds should be renewed every 3-5 years for best yield

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: Harvest when berries are fully red and ripe; best picked in the morning when cool
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Gently twist or snip berries from the stem to avoid damaging plants

varieties.June-bearing: Produces large, flavorful strawberries early to mid-season; good for fresh eating and freezing
varieties.Everbearing: Produces smaller berries in several flushes throughout the season; excellent for jams and preserves

wildlifeResistance: Susceptible to birds — use netting for protection
Susceptible to slugs — use slug traps or barriers
